item.title: The death of the for loop?
item.description: Generally introduced to new developers around chapter 4 or 5 of their proverbial Intro to Computer Science books, loops are one of the most fundamental coding constructs a developer learns. The different simple ways we iterate over collections of data are often the core of the most complex applications ever built. This is to dramatically justify the probably-overkill rant I am about to write regarding iterating over a collection of data.
